basics.name: Jessica Jones
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am Pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2021.

courses: Basic Circuit Analysis I and II (current)

work.summary: Assist the Information Security Team with daily operational tasks
highlights: Create and update information security documentation, articles, and social media
Assist in the creation of information security presentations
Research solutions related to information security issues

volunteer.summary: Mentor for the Moanalua and Mililani High School FIRST Robotics Teams
highlights: MoHS: Guide the rebranding of the robotics team, which included designing a new logo, T-shirts, and website
MHS: Direct the creation of weekly videos, newsletters, and thank you cards.

volunteer.summary: I assisted in the operation of multiple STEM Camps, which the Girl Scouts of Hawaii hosts annually to encourage girls and young women to learn about different STEM topics and career fields.
highlights: Design curriculum for and create hands-on activities

volunteer.organization: The Hawaii State Department of Education (HIDOE), Korea Ministry of Education and Institute of APEC Collaborative Education
volunteer.summary: Helped students collaborate to create educational mobile apps using MIT App Inventor

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Recognition given to students who earn a cumulative GPA of 3.51 or above.

awards.title: Valedictorian with Academic and CTE Honor Certificates
awards.summary: Valedictorian designation awarded for cumulative GPA of 4.00 or above as well meeting requirements of an Honors Certificate. The Career & Technical Education Honors Certificate is awarded to those who complete 2-3 years in a program of study. Academic Honors is awarded to students for completing four credits in both math and science; two of those credits being from an AP class.
